newsitem.title: UNITED NATIONS: U.N. Council renews Golan Heights force.
newsitem.headline: U.N. Council renews Golan Heights force.

text.p: The U.N. Security Council on Wednesday unanimously approved a six-month renewal, until Nov. 30, of the U.N. Disengagement Observer Force (UNDOF) that serves as a buffer between the Syrian and Israeli armies on the Golan Heights.
The 1,050-member force has been deployed since 1974 to monitor a ceasefire and troop withdrawal that followed the 1973 Middle East war.

The force comprises troops from Austria, Canada, Japan and Poland. Major-General David Stapleton of Ireland takes over as commander on June 1 to succeed Major-General Johannes Josters of the Netherlands.

U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan in a recent report said that unpaid assessments for UNDOF owed by U.N. members totalled about $48.2 million -- well over the force's current annual budget of some $32.3 million.
